Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

The contrived party is over at Fenway Park

In a last attempt to direct your eyes away from the field, the Red Sox unveiled their “All-Fenway Team’’ in a hollow celebration for a team that has lost its way.

Jaguar unleashes inner James Bond

Globe writer Joe Kahn drove a Jaguar sports car and tested his need for speed and braking.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

Joe Kennedy III is limiting debates

Kennedy has agreed to three debates with Sean Bielat in their race to replace Barney Frank in the US House. Frank and Bielat had nine debates two years ago.

Firm looks to reinvent toothbrush

A start-up, LittleBonsai, has launched ReBrush, a line of toothbrushes with disposable heads and handles constructed from wood or aluminum.
Opinion | Yvonne Abraham

Suit against casino foe is outrageous

Thomas Keen, who is fighting a proposed racecourse casino in Plainville, has been sued over a Facebook posting for which he is not even responsible.

Obama's natural gas stance has risks

President Obama’s pursuit of natural gas production risks alienating a component of his base and may oversell the potential for new jobs.
editorial

Brown should condemn native taunts

Tomahawk chops by Scott Brown campaign aides were meant to ridicule Elizabeth Warren’s having identified herself as part Native American.
